wikipedia_page.main: Sir Richard Atkinson Robinson, DL, (16 October 1849 – 28 April 1928) was a retail chemist and druggist, who later became a local politician and was the first member of the Municipal Reform Party (linked to the Conservatives) to lead the London County Council (1907–1908).

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: *Richard Robinson, Chairman of London County Council.
*Richard Robinson, leader of the London County Council 1907–08.

response: *Richard Robinson (Municipal Reform politician) (1849–1928), English politician and chemist
*Richard Robinson (chess player) (1956-2009), American and Bermudian chess player
*Richard Robinson (chief executive) (1937–2021), American chief executive officer
*Richard Robinson (festival director) (born 1953), puppeteer based in the UK
